title: Excellent value for your money!
content: I've been looking for a new car phone holder and decided that the magnetic ones was the one for me. After looking at some of the other magnetic ones and thought they are abit expensive for what they. I saw this one and thought this is at the right price. I can say this is perfect for me. The magnet is the right strength to hold the phone without any issues. I have iPhone xs max and it works well. Make sure you think about the placement of metal on your phone so you get it balanced. Don't forget to close the vent when you install it in your car. You don't want to heat up your phone or the holder. Ive got a BMW and you can see from the pictures where I've put mine. At this price I challenge you to find one better. I would recommend this item. Has this been helpful? then let me know.

title: Oh i love this holder.
content: This is incredible. I have had a few similar products in the past but they were the sticky pad type which fail to stick after time and mark the dashboard. This one is so much better. It grips into the vent so easily yet stays put. And it doesn't pull out when you yank your phone off the magnet. It is easily transferable from vehicle to vehicle. I use it in a Citroen C4 and a Volvo V40. When driving, it doesn't shake at all over the bumpy bits. Would I buy another? You bet. One tiny negative. My work van is a 2012 Iveco Daily and it has rubbish airvent that this does not fit into. Nothing wrong with the phone holder. Just be sure to check that your vehicle has normal vents before purchasing.

title: Fantastic for iPhone6+
content: I have an iPhone 6+ so it is quite large and heavy.  I needed a good reliable holder for my car as I tend to use Google Maps frequently now for navigation.  I first purchased a Vent Spring Loaded Holder.  It was not up to the job with the phone constantly tilting and falling.  I then bought a sucker type holder, which worked well for about 2 months, but then also started to "unfix" itself from the windscreen.  I think this is because the sucker cups are not the better quality, durable type ones you receive when you buy for example a TomTom. I then started looking again for a replacement and bought this Yosh magnetic holder.  Fantastic.  Works exactly how I want it to.  I have driven many miles and over rough terrain and the phone has stayed stuck to the holder with no problems so far.  The actual main holder itself also mounts the air vent very rigidly and firmly so this is good also. I would recommend this holder to people who are simply looking for a car holder that will keep their phone in place.  Please note that this product requires you to stick a strong 3M adhesive magnetic circle sticker on either your phone case or the phone itself.  I have stuck it on my iPhone 6+ itself as I do not use a case so my review is based on this.
author: Hytz
product: YOSH Car Phone Mount Holder Magnetic Air Vent in car Mobile Phone Cradle Magnet for iPhone 12 11 Pro Max XR XS Max X 8 7 6s Plus Samsung S20 S10+ A70 S10 Huawei P30 P20 Pro Xperia Xiaomi Oneplus etc.

title: A very Practical Purchase
content: Arrived on time.  Easy to set up and install.  The magnet is very strong.  Make sure you clean any grease or debris off your phone before putting the disk magnet on the back.  My phone is shattered on the back; I used one of the 2 clear plastic sticky disks that is included in the pack (which I assume are included to protect your phone if you don't want to stick the magnet directly to it).  Unfortunately, this kept falling off due to the nature of the state of my phone - but am certain that it would have definitely have worked had it not been for this.  So, that was one magnet and one plastic disk wasted (don't make the mistake and put it on an unclean surface like I did). The rubber 'holder' is really easy to install - simply press into your air vent blades until it clicks or sticks into place - if I can do it - anyone can.  It's still there not budged.  My phone is really secure - going fast, over speed bumps, around roundabouts - in fact all driving conditions hasn't made one bit of difference to how securely its held my phone in place.  I get fed up of those contraptions that hold your phone like in a vice-type grip as I find them cumbersome. This is perfect - just clip and go.  Grab at the other end - no fiddling.  It also means that as it's attached to the air vents, it does not obscure your full view of the windscreen and is discreetly attached and contained out of sight.  No sucker marks on the windscreen, no advertising your phone in full view.  I really like this product and am pleased with my purchase.  Well worth the money paid, and no searching for my phone in my bag anymore - I put it on the holder as soon as I get in my car - and at a side glance - know who is calling and if I need to pull over to take the call or not. Would recommend to my friends and family knowing it works and won't break the bank either.

title: Simple, minimal, and effective.

The only downside is that the adhesive sticker that you apply to the back of your phone or case, has begun to peel away which can be a little irritating, not enough though to deduct a full star. A smart design and an unbeatable price.

The disk is black, which matches my black case and doesn't look too obtrusive but would probable look odd on a different coloured case.  UPDATE: I just completed my first very long distance trip with this in the car and sadly the glue holding the disk to the phone case effectively melted in the heat (it was very hot - 30C) rendering it useless.  As this is an extreme case and I can use Gorilla glue to glue it back on more effectively I'm still leaving the review at 5*, especially considering the price.

title: Good bit of kit
content: This surprised me. I expected some Chinese tat, but I received a nicely made product, in a very smart box, with a user manual in good English. The gadget works very well. I takes about 3 seconds to install on the air vent and in use it is stable and neat. It holds my phone (Moto G6) well and the magnet is very powerful so there's no danger of the phone falling off, even on rough roads. It is also easily transferable from one vehicle to another, although at the price ¬£5.99) you might as well just buy another really. I didn't even need to stick the metal plate to anything - I just took the (gel) case off my phone, slipped the disc inside without removing the backing paper, and put the case back on. The case is a tight fit and holds the metal disc in place nicely. And the magnet is strong enough to work well even with the metal disc inside the (thin) case. This means I have *two* spare metal discs now, complete with adhesive should I need them in the future. Overall, a great product and a neat, practical solution to mounting my phone in my car. Recommended.

title: Works really well!
content: I wasn't entirely convinced that this would work until I tried it out! The magnet stuck to the back of your phone is hidden if you have a case and the neat vent fitting is completely unobtrusive. I drive on some reasonably interesting roads with potholes and although my phone has slipped or slightly turned, it hasn't fallen from the magnetic mount. I mainly use my phone to listen to podcasts and got fed up with leaving it in the cupholder or having it slide around the passenger footwell. This is a much cleaner solution to fixing a phone to your dash or windscreen, I would definitely recommend this product to people who want to have their phone somewhere handy!

title: Not amazing but I‚Äôm using it anyway
content: To tide me over until I can afford a new CarPlay stereo unit in my car, I decided to get a Bluetooth receiver and a phone holder so I can use my phone to the same effect. I didn‚Äôt want to get one that stuck on the dash, because there‚Äôs not really many great places to put it, and it can be a PITA to take off without leaving marks behind. I also wanted something that could magnetically hold my phone, since my phone case already had one from an old phone holder, and they‚Äôre a million times better than other phone holders in my opinion. That being said, the magnetic grip that this holder has on your phone is stronger than the grip it has on the car itself! If you try to pull it straight off, the holder will come off with the phone! So now I‚Äôve got to peel it off sideways, and even then it feels like it‚Äôs going to come off again. The grip this thing has on the car is absolutely naff. I‚Äôm also not 100% confident that this won‚Äôt just fly off mid-drive! I have it on my right hand side next to the window, and whenever I open the window I feel like it‚Äôs just going to fly out at one point. But what can I say, I have a Ford Focus ST so I guess I like to live dangerously. Overall, I don‚Äôt recommend this. Get something else.

title: Great phone mounting solution for your car..
content: Bought this as I wanted the ability to use my phone as a sat nav device and for it to be in position that is easy to connect to my aux cable to play music. You get a magnetic sticker that you stick to the back of your phone and a 'plug' mount holder that you attach to the air vent of your car (as shown in the pictures). The magnet on the back of the phone sticks to the front of the mount and voila! I like this method as it give you some flexibility in terms of  being able to manoeuvre your phone to your desired position and also a product that doesn't rely on sticking to your dashboard but being easy to insert and remove when required.  The magnet system is nice and strong and I have never had any issues with my phone sliding or slipping off the mount. One thing I wish I had done is stick the magnet to the back of my phone case rather then my phone as once you stick in on its really, really hard to get off. Another VERY important point to remember is to turn the vent off in your car when you have your phone attached as you'll either end up freezing it or frying it if you have it blasting out hot or cold air. This is a fantastic product that justifies it high ratings and at that price its a bargain. Would recommend.

title: Best Phone Mount
content: I really love this phone mount, I bought one a few years ago to use with my old phone, however I've just started using it again with my new phone. I forgot how good it was. One bit of advice is make sure you stick the little magnet thingy on a case not directly on your phone, the bloody thing won't come off haha. Another thing is make sure your vents in the car are reasonably stiff, so if you stick this on them they won't just move around when the car is moving. I bought another one of these mounts recently for my girlfriend however the vents in her A1 don't hold it properly and it falls out all the time. One thing I love about this is that even though the magnet you put on your phone is really thin, the force it holds the phone is unbelievable! Honestly I could do my most wildest driving and my phone would still be sat there in the centre of my dash.

title: A must have if you use sat nav apps
content: I was hesitant to purchase a phone holder that slotted into the vents of my car's air conditioning. Mainly because in the winter when set to hot I felt my phone would overheat. However, I've now had to purchase this as the windscreen arm mount I purchased previously has now lost any kind of suction and has become completely unusable. I've only used this in the summer so far with the air conditioning set to cold, so I can't comment on whether the phone overheats or not. Assembly is easy, you simply attach the magnet with the sticky tape provided to your phone case and place the magnetic holder into your car's air conditioning vents. The phone sits securely and I've yet to have any issues with it falling or becoming displaced. The drawback to this over a windscreen arm mount is the fact that you are unable to swivel the screen to face you and that you have to take your eyes off of the road a little bit more by looking down. It's not a major drawback but I feel it's something worth noting. All in all it does the job and is a must have for anybody that uses sat nav apps on their phone. 5 stars. *Please let me know if you found this review helpful*

title: A lot better than I thought
content: Just got a new car and I didn't want some huge bracket that sucks onto the window or something.  I thought I'd give this a shot as I've never tried one of these before.  I've been very pleasantly surprised having had this for a few weeks now and done a few decent enough drives to test it.  When I first got it, I stuck the disc to the inside of the rugged case for my Google Pixel phone.  Even with the thickness of the case, it still stays put when driving.  I've now got a new case and, as there was a spare disc, I put this on the outside of the case so it sticks to the holder even more securely.  I've probably done a few hundred miles on different roads and it hasn't fallen off once.  I have mine right at the very top slat on the vent.  The vents on my car are long and narrow so not ideal.  Having it at the top means that half the vent is still directing air towards me rather than straight at the back of the phone.  That's probably the only downside to this type of holder.  Depending on your car, you're effectively losing the output from one vent. All in all, I'm glad I got this.  It's definitely neat and it definitely holds my phone securely in a place where I can see it.  Can't really ask for more than that!

title: Works like a charm
content: I have been looking for a phone holder that actually does what it's supposed to do for so long. I've bought several holders, some of them did not stick to any internal part of my car, others did not hold the weight of the phone, nor provide a good viewing angle. The Yosh magnetic holder is a genius bit of kit. No bulky plastic arms or fiddly components. This is simple: slide-on a small magnetic holder to a ventilation grille, attach the disc to the back of the phone or case, and you're good to go. I love that you can rotate the phone 360 degrees, and you need only the one hand to remove the phone from the holder. You are supplied with 2 discs. This is a robust and well-manufactured product. It's pocket- and wallet- friendly, and made mostly from rubber, an almost everlasting material. Using four magnets in the holder, 2 North, 2 South, double the strength. When you put the phone on the holder, it just clicks into place, and likewise it just comes off with ease without needing to tug or yank. And importantly, the phone doesn't wobble or move at all while driving. I love using it. It satisfies me deeply, and it has fulfilled a need I had. 5 out of of 5, 10 out of 10, 100%.

title: Modern sleek and easy function
content: Product is ideal, very sleek and discreet looking product unlike the window suction mounts which are clunky and nasty looking. The magnetic adhesion works great and the magnet is super strong so no chance of falling off the mount. Was a little concerned the strong magnet would have an impact on the phones function but used for around a month now and all fine. The only minus to the product is depending on the vents you have, the weight will pull the vent down and the phone can face downwards, although only a minor flaw. Also be aware that if you have a car that you can't close the vent, the phone can either get very hot with the heating on or very cold with air con. Overall really pleased with the product and very quick and easy setup and connection when getting in/out the car.

title: Brilliant!
content: A mate showed me his magnetic phone holder and persuaded me to buy one so after checking a few out I plumped for this one. I'm very glad I did because it is brilliant and yet cheap as chips. It is made of soft rubber with a slot that pushes over one of your air vents, this does mean that that vent cannot be moved but that is a small inconvenience. It comes with two metal disks that stick on the back of your phone or phone cover and they stick really well. The phone then hangs off the holder really securely and never looks even like falling off, yet is easy to pull off when you need to. I have a book type cover for my phone so the flap is a bit of a pain but the phone still stays put. If you have a gel or hard plastic shell type cover then this would be even better. If you're sick of the normal type phone holder falling off the windscreen then this is the answer.

title: Not for me!
content: 16,979 review had to convince me to buy this product. It might have worked wonders for other buyers not for me. Starting with the plus - it arrived the next day in a small box with Happy/Not Happy card and some safety information. It has 2 magnetic metal  peel and stick circles for your phone/phone case(what ever you prefer). The holder is well built with soft material so it doesn't scratch your vent. Now the cons - its really awkward positioned on my Mazda 6. It fiddly and not steady at all. It continues to move while driving even though the phone is stuck steady. You cannot position it the way you want it. It just rely's on the shape of your car vent. So in short its not my cup of tea. I'll pass this on to my friend or someone who's car might be better suited to this kit. PS: Every top review on Amazon doesn't mean it will fit your purpose.

title: A very strong, great value magnetic mount
content: This is a mount for your car‚Äôs air vent. The mount slides onto the vent, and the front disc is magnetic. You get 2 sticky metal discs which you stick on your phone, and hey presto! The phone sticks to the mount! The mount is really easy to use- I‚Äôve got them on both a VW Golf and a Ford C Max. They will slide onto any slats, vertical or horizontal. The bit that grips on to the slats is rubber and doesn‚Äôt mark. It grips very well, but doesn‚Äôt pull the slats off when you remove it. The metal discs come with clear plastic discs to put underneath so your phone isn‚Äôt left with marks once removed. It took a minute to fit the discs. The mount is very magnetic and easily holds the phone without ever falling off or moving. I used my second disc to put on the back of my sat nav- brilliant alternative to having it blocking my view in the windscreen and no suction pad falling off! I use my phone to make contactless payments all the time and this hasn‚Äôt been effected by having a metal disc stuck on the back. I also have a case over the disc, just a normal plastic one, and this doesn‚Äôt effect how well the magnetic mount works. I was so impressed with this I immediately bought another so I‚Äôve got one for each car. So cheap and better than alternatives that you‚Äôd find in the shops.
author: Sophie
product: YOSH Car Phone Mount Holder Magnetic Air Vent in car Mobile Phone Cradle Magnet for iPhone 12 11 Pro Max XR XS Max X 8 7 6s Plus Samsung S20 S10+ A70 S10 Huawei P30 P20 Pro Xperia Xiaomi Oneplus etc.

title: Highly effective vent-mount. So good I bought another one for my wife to use!
content: Very impressed with the magnetic strength of this holder, and also very impressed with its ability to hold onto the vent louvres - far better than other ones I've tried and then thrown away, this one works properly! Beautifully designed in every detail, the magnetic unit is thick enough to clear the control lever on the vent grille so the lever doesn't foul on the back of my phone. Easily powerful enough to work well through the clear rubber protector on my phone - I mounted the disc on my phone because I want to be able to wash my protector from time to time without worrying about wetting the disc. I even tried it with a super-thick folio case on and there was still significant magnetism though not quite enough to safely hold it while driving, so if I want to use that case then I'll just stick another disc directly on the back of it. I would imagine this mount will work with any smooth flat-surfaced item you might want to attach to your vent, certainly up to the weight of a 6" phone but probably somewhat heavier too as it really clings well - the best way to remove it from the mount seems to be to twist-and-slide so it comes off without any risk of pulling the base out of the vent, but having said that, the base grips the vent extremely well too. Highly recommended. UPDATE - My MotoG6 has always had a very poor NFC response for contactless payments, and putting the Yosh disc in the centre of the rear of the phone (I believe Moto put the sweet spot under the "M" logo which is a really silly place for it, most phones seem to have it near the top of the phone) made NFC virtually unusable. I moved the disc a bit lower to clear the "M" logo and it's working better now.
author: Duzzitwerk

title: Suberb holder
content: Superb little gadget that does fit my square vent in a Discovery 2.  It is unobtrusive, still allows the vent to work but would recommend turning it off if you are blowing warm air through it as the phone can get quite warm.  One added advantage is that the back of my phone holder is metal and it holds itself, without the pads, onto the holder.  So for me it was quite simple to push the holder on to the fin of the vent and place the phone directly onto the holder: it took seconds and fits and looks very neat.  One down side is that the vent tends to move down in its housing due to the wear of central hinge of the vent and the weight of the phone.  I simply fitted a small piece of black rubber  wedge at the base of the vent, which stops the vent from moving downwards and the result is an upward tilted phone perfectly in line with my vision.  Fantastic value for money.

title: much, much better than the suction cup phone holders!
content: I wish I'd bought one of these years ago! There is zero chance of the thing dropping of your windscreen at a complex junction, as happened to me on more than a few occasions with suction cup phone holders. The only tip I can offer new buyers is to stick the disk to your phone when you are actually in your car. Why? because I stuck mine in the middle of the phone which, with my car's air vent, meant that the phone could be partially obscured by your hand when holding the steering wheel. In retrospect, sticking the disk to the bottom of the phone would have improved visibility a tad - but this was my lack of common sense rather than any problem with the product.

I've had issues where the foam adhesion over the magnet has melted off in the sun, the phone has been too heavy and while driving it's slipped off e.t.c (some of these were the super strong neodyme magnets) Sat in a family members car and saw this in their airvent and just walked my phone on. After about 40 mins I realised it was still there and held well. Noticed that it has a soft rubber like coating which wraps around the magnet so it won't peel off In the heat also it has a big face plate but a low profile so it doesn't stick out. It also holds well to the vent without the feeling it's going to damage it. I ordered one and am well pleased. After 3 months I'm still happy and now will order more.

title: Would be great if the adhesive was stronger
content: Great idea, nice neat little circle that fits reasonably well into the car vent.  Magnetic is super-powerful, but too powerful for the magnetic disc that goes onto the back of the phone.  On first use, the magnetic disc came off the back of the phone.  Decided to tape over it for two reasons. 1. To try and get the disc to stay on the phone and 2. To add a layer between the two magnets to reduce the suction!  It worked because the disc is still attached, but the second time the power of the super-powerful magnet pulled the whole thing off the air vent!  So either way I lost.  Now, I have a second layer of tape over the disc to reduce the suction even further and I‚Äôm careful when removing it from the air vent.  So I made the best of a bad job. I can see there are loads of good reviews, so can anybody tell me what I‚Äôm doing wrong?  I‚Äôd like this to work properly!!  I do still have one magnetic circle left, so any advice would be great!

title: Best phone holder I‚Äôve ever used. Indispensable on long journeys.
content: After trying a few different types of phone holder over the years, this is most definitely the best I‚Äôve had and is actually usable. The suction to the phone is superb but the main thing that makes this model stand out from all of the others is its ability to stay stuck to the air vent and not droop, fall out or twist or turn because the phone is too heavy for it. The simple but effective design means that it is very streamlined with the vent, so, unlike others I have tried, it is far more stable and copes with the weight of the phone better. It was indispensable for me on a recent 10 hour car journey. One cautionary note: You do need to be able to attach a thin circular magnet to the back of your phone (this is provided free with the holder, along with a sticky tab to attach it to your phone) in order for the phone to ‚Äòstick‚Äô to the holder. This doesn‚Äôt damage your phone in any way, but is just something to think about as it affects the appearance of the back of your phone. The power of the magnet even works through a phone cover, although for best results, it is advisable to remove the cover, especially for long journeys.

title: Works great!
content: I got this holder as I thought the 'clamp' type ones would obscure the screen when using maps to navigate. I put the clear protective sticker on the back of the phone and stuck the metal disc to the inside of the case, so no external change to the phone.  The magnetic mushroom part holds well into the car vent (2011 Seat Leon) and the hold of the phone feels quite firm too.  I tested it with a 6.5hr round trip to a client site and even with a cable plugged in to keep the battery charged, the holder worked perfectly.  Would recommend

product: YOSH Car Phone Mount Holder Magnetic Air Vent in car Mobile Phone Cradle Magnet for iPhone 12 11 Pro Max XR XS Max X 8 7 6s Plus Samsung S20 S10+ A70 S10 Huawei P30 P20 Pro Xperia Xiaomi Oneplus etc.

title: Does the job
content: This product attaches to horizontal vents.  The manufacturer recommends that you not use the heater when the phone is in tge holder. (One can use the floor vents alone on most cars so you can use the heater without blasting your phone with hot air.) If also says it may not work on vertical vents but I found it to be more stable on the multi-directional vents in my Aygo when they were turned to the vertical position. The magnet is powerful enough to hold an iPhone 7+ in a (light) case.
author: Dr. W. T. Flynn
product: YOSH Car Phone Mount Holder Magnetic Air Vent in car Mobile Phone Cradle Magnet for iPhone 12 11 Pro Max XR XS Max X 8 7 6s Plus Samsung S20 S10+ A70 S10 Huawei P30 P20 Pro Xperia Xiaomi Oneplus etc.

title: Stick with it
content: Flexible to fit different vent types whether verticle slats or horizontal. Also has enough depth for the round dome shaped vents. Magnet itself doesn't protrude out too much so phone is flush with dash. Comes with large metal plate with super strong adhesive that easily sticks to phone or case. Would recommend sticking to phone and have plastic/rubber case over the top. Suction is still strong enough to keep phone gripped and stable. I had it this way originally but stuck it in back of case so plate makes direct contact with magnet and find sometimes suction is so strong it pulls the holder off the vent. Because I can place the phone on vents its lower down meaning I can use a much shorter charge cable (0.30cm)  and not have wires all over the dash. Overall great product at a great price.
author: Rob
product: YOSH Car Phone Mount Holder Magnetic Air Vent in car Mobile Phone Cradle Magnet for iPhone 12 11 Pro Max XR XS Max X 8 7 6s Plus Samsung S20 S10+ A70 S10 Huawei P30 P20 Pro Xperia Xiaomi Oneplus etc.

title: Amazing
content: One of the best phone holders for your car! I've had this product for a few months now and I can safely say it's not only functional but very minimalistic. There's nothing worse than getting into your car and not knowing where to put your phone, this product essentially eliminates this problem and every time you go for a drive you can simply pop the phone onto the holder without having to worry about the trouble of fiddling with a traditional plastic phone holder. Pros - Strong Magnet, never once fell off - Product includes 2 magnets and protective stickers - Good Design, 2 colour options - Minimal branding - Good margin for error, the product allows you to place your phone effortlessly even with your eyes closed - Longevity is not a problem, no loss in strength of the magnet - included magnet works through my Spigen silicon phone case - The clip on the magnet itself is strong and is tension based, has not shown any signs of wear and tear Cons - Only suitable for horizontal vents - included magnet does add slight thickness to your phone, but not noticeable to cause annoyance - Passengers who wish to attach their phones for navigation can't use this As you can see from my experience, the pros greatly outweigh the cons. In conclusion, this is a great product for those who just want an easy place to put their phone without having to think of a place to put it if their car is slightly messy. Especially in those moments when you are in a rush, it is essential that you think twice about where to place your phone. I never want to go back to a traditional phone holder. Would highly recommend.

title: This does not work if you have a magnet on your case
content: The yosh holder works with the given metal plate that you stick to your phone however if your phone case has a magnet it does not work very well as 2 of the 4 magnets are reversed and repels your case magnet. I have a rockform case which i use for cycling and wanted to use the same case. I dismantled the Yosh  holder  (Remove the clip rubber cover and unscrew to separate the round plates ) and reversed 2 of the repealing magnets. Now it works great.

title: Excellent design - and value for money
content: Excellent design. Main concerns were lack of grip on the vent and too strong/weak grip on phone. Grip is strong on the vent so mount stays put. You get two discs (one and one spare) which you can attach to the phone. I opted to put both inside the case rather than stick them to my phone. Adding both created a larger magnetic area. The grip is strong enough to keep the phone in place and deal with a bumpy ride without falling off, but equally easy to dismount without taking the mount with it. When phone not in situ the mount blends as well as any mount can - looks good. For ¬£5.99 this is great, no hesitation in recommending and despite the good reviews I was still sceptical but nothing to worry about. 100% recommended.

It is easy to clean and doesn‚Äôt gather dust like other bigger holders might do. I don‚Äôt have a single complaint about this product and would recommend to anyone!

title: Perfect for my large-ish OnePlus mobile which I use as a satnav
content: Perfect for my needs. I stuck the disc on the underside of my case rather than to my phone or the outside of the case. I attached the main part to my car vent and it was so easy to get in my car and just place the phone onto the holder to use as my satnav. My passengers are always impressed. The holder is easily taken off to use in someone's car as well if you are their passenger and your phone is being used as their satnav. It was very secure. title: Probably the best money I've spent in a long time. Great product!
content: Arrived super fast and well packaged. From opening the packaging for this product to fitting it onto the car dash vent took approx. 5 minutes and works absolutely great. The fitting instructions were very clear and very brief. No in-depth explanation needed. Simply attach the non-magnetic adhesive metal disc provided to the back of your smart-phone, and attach the main magnetic holder onto a suitable air vent on the dashboard of your vehicle. That's it! You can now magnetically attach your smartphone to your vehicle dashboard using the very powerful magnetic mount. Note that the instruction manual says that the magnetic mount is not suitable for air vents with vertical slats. Alternatively, if your phone has a protective case, remove the phone from the case and attach the metal disc to the inside (or outside) of the case, then replace the phone back into the case. The phone will then be supported by the case, which in turn is being magnetically held in place. 2 adhesive metal discs are provided and according to online information, the magnetic mount has no adverse effects on your smartphone's operation. A very handy vehicle phone accessory.

title: Would recommend as a means of keeping phone stable in the car
content: For the price, this was definitely one of my good decisions. My mum has a sort-of spider thing, where you sit your phone in it and bend the legs around your phone to keep it from falling out. This is a much, much smoother option. I think it works better if you're using a case, which I imagine most do. This is because you have to attach onto either the back of your phone or the inside of your case the black metal disc that is attracted to the magnet. If you've got a phone any other colour than black this would stand out a bit. It wouldn't be difficult to remove from your phone because you first put on a thin clear layer first, but I think wouldn't look ideal. Assuming you're using a case, just take it off your phone, stick the metal disc to the back (the side that touches the back of your phone) and put the case back on. I've not seen any difference in how the back of my phone feels and doubt you would too. The reason I've given this 4 instead of 5* is because it's not as difficult as maybe it ought to be to miss the sweet spot in the middle of the metal disc. If one accidentally presses your phone (maybe 'presses' is the wrong word because you only need to hold it against it for a moment) so only the top/side/bottom of the metal disc is contacting the magnet, the slightest force, such as from the car moving, can cause your phone to fall off. It's not difficult to check your phone is stable before you set off though, and this has only happened once or twice to me in the several weeks that I've had it. If you have a larger phone it might be worth holding the phone against the holder in situ to see whether you want to stick the metal disc towards the upper or lower of your case, maybe to aid visibility of the screen for sat nav or to avoid conflicting with other bits of the car. In summary, I would recommend this to friends and family and have done already. My mate was looking for something like this and hasn't been unhappy with her purchase either.

title: Imagine it‚Äôd be amazing in a warm country...

I had an iPhone X before and had to choose between this mount and wireless charging. I went with the mount. Now I have an iPhone 11 and stuck with wireless charging. The next iteration needs to find a balance between both. 2. When it‚Äôs mounted in the car, it‚Äôs usually on a radiator. In warm weather where you‚Äôd hardly use your car radiator it‚Äôs no problem. But when you‚Äôre dealing with below freezing weather and blasting hot air in the car it‚Äôs absolutely boils the back of your phone. Use at your own risk!

All in all it's a great purchase, and at the price I paid an absolute bargain. Highly recommend to everyone.

None of them adhered to a transit dashboard, I left the first one for 24 hours and the second and third for 48 hours at least and as soon as I put my phone on them it fell off. I followed the instructions and pushed down for 10 seconds. I also tried 2 desperate flat(ISH) locations, but it didn't bond to either.

This is not the way to "install" the holder - the thin edge of the holder has a slit - it's this slit that slots *onto* the edge of a grill, for a tight fit. Once I did that, it was plain sailing. Highly recommended.
